column1: '''Norman Keeps''' was a [[Man]] living in the [[wikipedia:20th century
''Norman Keeps'' was not his actual name, but rather a nickname that [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham
column3: Frankley]] gave him. He was their barber, and a nice and moderately intelligent men, but to him, everything that the "[[wikipedia:Dark Ages
column4: Dark Ages]]" stood for were "Norman Keeps", "Them Jameses", "The Squires" and "The People".<ref>{{SD

column1: ''Norman Keeps'' was an actual person, who expounded to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] the view of [[wikipedia:English history
column2: English history]] as recounted by the eponymous character in the story. He was a barber too.<ref>{{SD
